did.unittitle: American Philosophical Society Archives. Record Group IIe
did.abstract:
This is part of the large inventory for the American Philosophical Society Archives. For complete information concerning this collection, please view the
Collection Description.

did.unittitle: Papers
Letter to [George] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p., address and endorsement. A.N.S. Has borrowed A.P.S. Transactions, n.s., VI.

did.unittitle: Letter to the members of the American Philosophical Society,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p. and address. A.L.S. Declines nomination to the presidency of the A.P.S. Enclosed in: Patterson to Franklin Bache, January 17, 1845.

did.unittitle: Letter to Robley Dunglison,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Secretary of A.P.S., Washington, 1 p. A.L.S. Acknowledges his "election as one of the Vice Presidents of the American Philosophical Society."

did.unittitle: Letter to G[eorge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Boston, 1 p., address and endorsement. Returns volume of Penn's letters. Hopes to send "in due time the other two vols. of Hist. of U. S. and I hope a fourth."

did.unittitle: Letter to Geo[rge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Concerning the election of new members to the American Philosophical Society.

did.unittitle: Letter to Franklin Bache,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 2 pp. and address. A.L.S Declines election as president of the A.P.S. See also, Patterson to members of the A.P.S., January 3, 1845.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hartford, A.L.S.: Cha[rle]s Hosmer. 1p.,end.and add. Thanks for Proceedings.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society, Philadelphia;

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: Walter R. Johnson. 1p.,end.and add. Thanks for Proceedings.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia] 1 p., address and endorsement. A.N.S. Requests that books (not named) be delivered to bearer.

did.unittitle: Letter to G[eorge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of the A.P.S., Boston, 1 p. address and endorsement. A.L.S. The Boston Society of Natural History forwards the missing numbers of its Journal to the A.P.S.

did.unittitle: Letter to W. S. Young;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p.and add. George Ord will furnish coal. On same sheet is letter form W.S.Young to G. Ord; [Feb. 2, 1845].

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. Asks for coal. On same sheet as letter from Isaac Lea to W. S. Young; Feb. 1, 1845.

did.unittitle: Letter to ----,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, 1 p. and endorsement. A.L.S. Has signed and returned the diplomas (of membership in the A.P.S.).

did.unittitle: Letter to [the American philosophical society];

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Vienna, L.S. 1p.,end. Forwards publications.

did.unittitle: Letter to the President of the A.P.S.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, 1 p., address and endorsements. L. in 3d. per. Forwards package from Vienna to the A.P.S.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Philadelphia, 1 p. and endorsement. A.N.S. Requests that a special meeting of the A.P.S. be called for Friday evening next.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Washington, 2 pp., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Inquires as to location of certain rare botanical works. "Captain Wilkes is now in Philadelphia . . . "

did.unittitle: Committee of the Athenaeum to Franklin Bache,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 2pp. L.S.: T[homas] I.Wharton, and others. Proposal that the Athenaeum and A.P.S. erect a building "upon the present Lot for the accommodation of both Institutions." See Pro., IV, 142.

did.unittitle: Letter to the [American] Philosophical Society,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Havre, 1 p. and endorsement. A.L.S. (In French.) Presents to the A.P.S.: a copy of his Geological Views of the Falaises at the Cape of Laheve. See Pro., IV, 153. (For map see: 242.1.937:1843:L565vch.

did.unittitle: Letter to ----,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Buenos Ayres, 1 p. and endorsement. A.L.S. (In French.) Regarding an error in the title of a pamphlet by him. See Pro., IV, 161.

did.unittitle: Letter to R[obley] Dunglison,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Secretary of the A.P.S., Washington, 1 p. and endorsement. A.L.S. Encloses letter from the French minister explaining gift of books from the Minister of War to the A.P.S.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on proposal of Athenaeum to erect building for the joint use of the two societies;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia] D.S.: R.M. Patterson, G.Ord, Isaac Lea, Geo. W. Smith and Geo. M. Justice. 2p., end. See APS Proc., IV, 146.

did.unittitle: Letter to Franklin Bache,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: President of the [American] Philosophical Society, Philadelphia, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Transmits to the A.P.S.: a package of books from M. Berzelius of Stockholm. See Pro., IV, 143.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, L.S.: W.McLain. 1p.,end. Thanks for Transactions. Forwards publications.

did.unittitle: Letter to Geo[rge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Will be impossible for him to meet committee this afternoon.

did.unittitle: Letter to G[eorge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Philadelphia, 1p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Will forward package for Royal Society of Sciences of Upsal, by way of New York, when opportunity offers.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boston, A.L.S.: H.I.Bowditch. 1p.,end.: A.L. Elwyn and add. Thanks for publications.

did.unittitle: Letter to Robley Dunglison,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Columbia, Pa., 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. The Natural History Society of Bern, Switzerland, desires to exchange its Denkschriften for the Transactions of American scientific societies.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on paper by [S. S.] Haldeman on the "Coleoptera longicorna of the United States";

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], D.S.: T. R. Peale, Isaac Lea, and G. Ord. 1p. , end. See APS Proc. , IV, 49. Printed: APS Trans., n.s., X, 27-66.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Boston, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. The librarian of the Boston Society of Natural History requests A.P.S. Transactions, n.s., I, III, V, and Proceedings, nos. 21 and 24.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord, Librarian of A.P.S.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, 3 pp. and endorsement. A.L.S. Suggests that Charles L. Bonaparte be authorized to represent the A.P.S. at meeting of the Italian Scientific Association at Naples in October. See Pro., Iv, 153-154 Printed: APS Proceedings, Vol.90, No.5,December,1946.

did.unittitle: Letter to [Peter S.] DuPonceau, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: E.Chevreul and Jussieu. 1p.,end.: A.L.Elwyn. In French. Thanks for Transactions and Proceedings

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of the A.P.S., Boston, 2 pp., address and endorsement. A.L.S. The Boston Society of Natural History sends to the A.P.S.: pp. 129-200 of Proceedings, and Journal, V, no. 1.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Washington, 1 p., address and endorsement A.L.S. Requests two copies of Proceedings of A.P.S. centennial.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, Printed D.filled in in ms.S.: John J. Bennett. 1p.,end.: J.F.F[isher] and add. Thanks for publications.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Leghorn, 1 p., address and endorsement. L.S. (Duplicate.) Offers to sell his secret of fixation of mercury to the A.P.S. Enclosed in Sartori to Ord, April 29, 1845.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society Philadelphia;

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Royal Asiatic Society of Great Britain and Ireland

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: R.Clarke. 1p.,end. Thanks for publications.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, 1 p., address and endorsements. A.N.S. Requests a complete set of A.P.S. Transactions, old series, as he can sell the same.

did.unittitle: Letter to Geo[rge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Leghorn, 1p. and endorsement. L.S. By brig Aldebaran sends piece of fiexed mercury to Mr. Ord, to be shown to the A.P.S. See Pro., IV, 184.

did.unittitle: Letter to [George] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Treasurer of the A.P.S., R[oya]l College of Surgeons, [London], 1 p. A.L.S. Acknowledges receipt of diploma of membership in the A.P.S.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: Wm.J. Hamilton. 1p.,end.and add.: P.Vaughan, Esq. Thanks for publications.

did.unittitle: Receipt to the American Philosophical society for hospital expenses ofr Augustus Larrentree;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D.S.: Wm. G. Malin. 1p.,end.and end. Paid by George ord.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Boston, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. The librarian of the Boston Society of Natural History requests a copy of the Catalogue of the Library of the A.P.S., published in 1824.

did.unittitle: Receipt to the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, D.S.: Edward Armstrong. 1p., and end. Receipt for portrait of DuPonceau, "allowed to be copied for the use of the Law Academy of Philadelphia."

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, 1 p. and endorsement. A.L.S. Presents copy of his Narrative of the Exploring Expedition to the A.P.S.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Secretary of the A.P.S., [Philadelphia], 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Is disposed to become tenant of office below Athenaeum at $150 per year. Not found May, 2011.

did.unittitle: Letter to G[eorge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of the A.P.S., New York, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Returns designated books to the A.P.S. Will present a copy of his essay for the Ethnological Association of New York as soon as it appears.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Treasurer of A.P.S., Military Academy, West Point, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. The Superintendent of the Military Academy requests information as to subscription to Astronomische Nachrichten.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Presents a copy of Etudes sur les Échinides, by Charles des Moulins. Also some reports and a catalogue of birds. See Pro., IV, 172.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Albany, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. The secretary of the New York State Library submits a list of A.P.S. publications in their possession, with request that deficiencies be filled, if possible.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of the A.P.S., [Philadelphia], 1 p. and endorsement. A.L.S. Has requested Mr. John Haviland to examine room below Athenaeum to determine the need of repairs.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: Wm.Ogilby. 1p.,end. Thanks for the Proceedings.

did.unittitle: Letter to G[eorge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p. and endorsement. A.N.S. Has decided not to rent room under the Athenaeum, but to take an office elsewhere. Not found May, 2011.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: John J. Bennett. 1p.,end.and add. Thanks for publications.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: R.Harris. 1p.,end. Thanks for publications.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Albany, Printed L.filled in in ms. S.: T.Romeyn Beck. 1p.,end.and add. Thanks for Proceedings and Transactions

did.unittitle: Isaac Lea to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.N.S. Requests balance due the Publications committee.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Venice, A.L.S. 1p.and end. In Italian. Presents five scientific works to the society (listed in letter).

did.unittitle: Letter to J.K. Kane;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: Francis Whishaw. 1p.,end.: R.D[unglison]. Thanks for publications of APS.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: U. S. Mint, [Philadelphia], 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Wishes to borrow [William] Marsden, Numismata orientalia illustrata.

did.unittitle: Statement of account with the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, D. 1p.and end. In French.

did.unittitle: Letter to [the American Philosophical Society],

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, 1 p. and endorsements. Pr.D. Treasury department directs map of New York bay and harbor to be sent to the A.P.S.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: George Gibbs. 1p.,end.and add. Thanks for Proceedings.

did.unittitle: Letter to R[obley] Dunglison, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: S.Hunter Christie. 1p.,end.and add. Thanks for publication on DuPonceau.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: S.Hunter Christie. 1p.,end.and add. Thanks for Proceedings and Proceedings of the academy of natural sciences.

did.unittitle: Letter to G[eorge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Paris, 2 pp., address and endorsement. A.L.S. (In French.) Acknowledges receipt of several letters. Book news.

did.unittitle: Letter to Geo[rge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p., address and endrosement. Wishes to purchase A.P.S. Transactions, I, III, and XIII.

did.unittitle: Letter to the Secretary of the A.P.S.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, 1 p. and endorsement. A.L.S. (In French.) Presents to the A.P.S.: Etudes sur l'histoire primitive des races Océaniennes et Américaines.

did.unittitle: Letter to the Librarian of the A.P.S.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rome, 1 p. and endorsement. Unsigned extract of L. Returns thanks for having been chosen as the representative of the A.P.S. at the Seventh Congress of the Italian Association, to be held at Naples in September next. Printed: APS Proceedings, Vol.90, no.5 December,1946.

did.unittitle: Letter to Geo[rge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p., address and endorsement. A.N.S. Introducing Mr. [Richard S.] McCulloh, who wishes to consult certain books in the library of the A.P.S.

did.unittitle: Letter to Geo[rge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Borrowed [Samuel] Kidd's work on China, which he has passed on to [Horace] Binney.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of the A.P.S., Fernbank,Ohio, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Presents a few botanical catalogues of his friend, Dr. Chapman, of Florida. Introduces his son and Mr. Richardson.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Philadelphia, 1 p., address and endorsement A.L.S. Requests Mr. Ord to order nos. 527 and 528 of the Astronomische Nachrichten for him.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Moscow, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: Renard. 1p.,end. In French. Forwards publication.

did.unittitle: Letter to Robley Dunglison,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Albany, 2 pp., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Lists various publications of the A.P.S. in which the New York State Library is deficient. Hopes to complete files. See Pro., IV, 190.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on a paper by William McIlvaine, "A perpetual calendar, civil and ecclesiastical";

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia] D.S.: R. M. Patterson, John F. Frazer, and Sears C. Walker. 1p., end. See APS Proc., IV, 192-197. Printed: APS Trans.,n.s.,X,103-129.

did.unittitle: Report of the committee on the claim of the executors of Mr. Nathan Dunn;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia] D.S.: Clement C. Biddle, H. J. Williams, J. K, Kane, J. J. Vanderkemp. 3p. and end. See APS Proc., IV, 196.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Requests use of room for Wistar Party on Friday evening next.

did.unittitle: Letter to I[saac] Lea;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, L.S.by W.H. Fox. 1p.and add.,end. Concerning the delivery of coal.

did.unittitle: Letter to Isaac Lea;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p.and add. Concerning the delivery of coal.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Albany, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. The secretary of the New York State Library acknowledges the receipt of certain numbers of A.P.S. Proceedings. See Pro., IV, 198.

did.unittitle: Letter to Robley Dunglison,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.N.S. Is holding some volumes from St. Petersburg (not named) for the A.P.S.

did.unittitle: Letter to Alfred L. Elwyn,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Secretary of A.P.S., Philadelphia, 1 p. and endorsement. A.L.S. Hopes to have obituary notice of the late [William H.] Keating ready in the course of November. See Pro., IV, 203.

did.unittitle: Letter to G[eorge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boston, 3 pp. and endorsement. A.L.S. Has received package from London containing magnetic observations at Toronto, and The Magnetic Observatory at Philadelphia, for the A.P.S.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Inquires whether Mr. Ord has come upon a copper plate of insects amon [John] Vaughan's effects.

did.unittitle: Letter to Robley Dunglison,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2 pp., address and endorsement. L.S. Concerning the fixation of mercury. Regrets lack of interest on part of A.P.S. This my force him to sell secret to one of the European scientific societies. See Pro., IV, 226.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society, Philadelphia;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Stockholm, Printed L.filled in ms.S.: Svedborn. 1p.,end. In French. Thanks for publications and forwards their publications.

did.unittitle: Letter to the Secretary of the A.P.S.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, 1 p., address and endorsement. L.S. Presents to the A.P.S.: Papers on Practical Engineering, no. 3.

did.unittitle: Receipt to the American philosophical society for ground rent taxes;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, D. 1p.,end.by [George Ord],and end.

did.unittitle: Report of committee for revising the laws;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia] D.S.: G.Ord, R.M. Patterson, and W.H. Dillingham. 1p. and end. See APS Proc., IV, 210.

did.unittitle: Report of committee on a paper by Major James D. Graham, "Observations for the magnetic dip...in 1840;"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Philadelphia], D.S.: Sears C. Walker, R.M. Patterson, and John F. Frazer. 1p., end. See APS Proc., IV, 205-207. Printed: APS Trans., n.s., IX, 329-345.

did.unittitle: Treatise on the parallactic eyepieces
Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, 1 p. A.L.S. Requests that parcel from [Stephen] Alexander be sent to [Eugenius] Nulty. Death of [D. B.] Warden.

did.unittitle: Statement of the value of marks, made to Robert Orr;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.D.S. 2p.and add.,end.

did.unittitle: Letter to George Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Princeton, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Note of apology for delay in returning books to the A.P.S. library.

did.unittitle: Letter to the American philosophical society;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p.,end.and add. Forwards pamphlets from Upsala.

did.unittitle: Letter to [Robley] Dunglison,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, 1 p., address and endorsement. A.L.S. Acknowledges receipt of letter. Will write to Baltimore and endeavor to get [J. N.] Nicollet's Journal of his life. FILM403 FRAME 47

did.unittitle: Letter to G[eorge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Librarian of A.P.S., Washington, 1 p. A.L.S. Has applied to Department of State for public documents to be sent to A.P.S. Has been unable to obtain results. See Buchanan to Ingersoll, Dec. 16, 1845; Ingersoll to Ord, Dec. 18, 1845.

did.unittitle: Letter to John K. Kane, Secretary of the A.P.S.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ls-1 Buenos Aires, 1 p. and endorsement. A.L.S. (In French.) Presents collection of documents upon British and French relations with the Argentine.

did.unittitle: Letter to [the American Philosophical Society],

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, 1 p. Pr.D. [Treasury department] directs the final sheets of map of New York bay and harbor to be sent to the A.P.S.

did.unittitle: [Publication of the American Philosophical Society in the Library of Congress,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, 1 p. D. Unsigned. Handwriting that of J. R. Ingersoll. Enclosed in: Ingersoll to Ord, December 9, 1845.

did.unittitle: Letter to Geo[rge] Ord,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, 2 pp. and endorsement. A.L.S. Encloses list of publications of the A.P.S. in the Library of Congress. Has communicated with secretary of state in re claims of A.P.S.

did.unittitle: Letter to G[eorge] Ord;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Albany, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.: T.Romeyn Beck. 1p.and add.,end. Thanks for Proceedings.

scopecontent.p: 249[45]p, Manuscript Beginning with meeting of Feb. 28, 1874, the minutes are clippings from newspapers with ms. additions. Contains also printed constitution of the Society, and news clippings relative to decease of members, etc. Not found May, 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
